bug.short_desc: Error while disposing Event Iframe demo

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce:
Firefox (tested in 3.0.7 under Linux): 1. Open the Demo Browser and run the event.EventIframe demo. 2. Run any other demo. Firebug displays the following message: self.dispose is not a function http://172.17.13.245:8000/application/demobrowser/build/script/demobrowser.demo.event.Event_Iframe-qx.theme.Modern.js Line 983
This error occurs only once, i.e. the Demo Browser has to be reloaded in order to reproduce it.
The behavior is the same in Internet Explorer (tested in 8.0), except here the error occurs every time the Event Iframe demo is disposed.
Opera (tested in 9.64 under Windows and Linux) behaves differently: 1. Open the Demo Browser and run the event.EventIframe demo. Result: The Iframe fails to load and the error console displays the following message: Statement on line 983: Type mismatch (usually non-object value supplied where object required) Backtrace: Line 983 of linked script http://172.17.13.245:8000/application/demobrowser/build/script/demobrowser.demo.event.Event_Iframe-qx.theme.Modern.js self.dispose();
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
